heading: best of the webbys speeches
subheading: award winners at the webbys are limited to five words in their acceptance speeches. here are some of the best ones from the 2000 webbys, presented on may 11 at the masonic auditorium.
author: wired staff
text: san francisco -- one of  the webbys' charms is that organizers limit award winners to just five words for their acceptance speeches.some of the winners choose their words wisely, others not so. here's a list of some of the best:"three letters: i p o." -- adbusters (activism)"thanks -- come talk to us." -- café utne (community)"antidisestablishmentarianism. pseudo-psychoanalysis. poly-vinyl ethelene. onomatopoeia. supercalifragilisticexpealadocious." --merriam-webster word central (education)"everyone likes the licky-licky." -- gamespy.com (games)"they said i could only..." -- the onion (humor)"i'm not paul smith." -- paul smith (fashion)"screw with your mind." -- nerve.com (print/zines)"is this thing edible?" -- epicurious (food)
